title: What is the meaning of the song Vincent by Don McLean? - Quora

response.answer_text: Vincent, by Don McLean is about Vincent Van Gogh, the impressionist painter. The lyrics suggest his struggle with “seeing the world differently” and not getting enough recognition (during his life) as a painter, McLean refers to one of his paintings that Vincent called: Starry, Starry, Nights (One of my favorites by Van Gogh) and how no one would give him acclaim. He suffered from mental health problems and thought he was going mad…so Don McLean says in this song: “I could have told you Vincent, this world was NEVER made for someone as beautiful as you”…..exonerating Van Gogh after death from the demons he fought while painting,

It was a tribute to the 18th century poet and artist Vincent Van Gogh. Who suffered from depression and took his own life (committed suicide). It is a sad and poignant story. Because back then, anyone who suffered from a depressive illness was usually ostracized by society. It flared up and caused others around them to become frightened and sometimes would have them unfairly incarcerated, etc. especially into an insane asylum. Van Gogh, it is presumed, was to have suffered from manic-depressive illness. But at the time there was nothing to give him to alleviate the severe symptoms of it, there were no psychotropic drugs and or therapies around back in his days. I don’t know very much about Van Gogh, only what I have heard from others and what I have seen and heard about him in the media. He also cut his own ear lobe off and bled to death. That is how he took his own life. He may have suffered from (auditory hallucinations) paranoid schizophrenia. Again they didn’t know what it was back then, and the only treatment for it was to be confined to an asylum.
